title: Haitian Creole
summary: Haitian  Creole (/ˈheɪʃən ˈkriːoʊl/; Haitian Creole: Kreyòl ayisyen;[6][7] French: Créole haïtien), commonly referred to as simply Creole, is a French-based creole language spoken by 10–12 million people worldwide, and is one of the two official languages of Haiti, where it is the native language of a majority of the population.[8][9]
